comment.body: I guess that the bastards haven't been driven out of business by competition then. Otherwise they would not be able to afford that kind of mistreatment of passengers.

To continue my last comment, if the competition has not driven them out of the market, then the very people, who are suffering from the bad treatment are self guilty of not choosing alternative transportation means. It's not just that one train company competes with another train company. It's also that one form of transportation competes with another form of transportation. Fishermen compete with meat farmers, wheat growers compete with potato growers, etc.
